text:
Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has once again been questioned in connection with his wife Sunanda Pushkar’s death and the special investigation team probing the high-profile case may summon him again, Delhi Police Commissioner B.S. Bassi said on Sunday.

“I must say that I am sure that we are on the right track and the Special Investigation Team (SIT) is doing a great job,” Mr. Bassi said, adding that a number of reasons were responsible for the “slow” progress in the case.

Mr. Tharoor, who is Lok Sabha member from Thiruvanathapuram, was questioned for nearly five hoursat the Anti-Auto Theft Squad office onthe premises of the Vasant Vihar police station on Saturday, a source said.

He was subjected to three rounds of questioning around one year ago.

On Mr. Tharoor’s questioning, Mr. Bassi said, “Whatever clarifications were required to be obtained from Shashi Tharoor, those perhaps have been obtained.”

“If SIT thinks further clarification is required, it may summon Mr. Tharoor again,” he said. — PTI
title: Tharoor quizzed, can be summoned again, says Bassi
